name: The house of pledge of allegiance
description: {'Site and history': ["Al-Bay'ah House (House of Allegiance) is located in the historic Al-Koot neighborhood of Hofuf. The house's construction dates back to a period preceding King Abdulaziz's allegiance, and it was owned by the Al-Mulla family. The house gained its fame and historical significance after witnessing a pivotal event in the Kingdom's history: the allegiance sworn to King Abdulaziz by the people of Al-Ahsa in 1331 AH/1913 CE, making it an integral part of the Kingdom's unification history."], 'Architecture and design': ["Al-Bay'ah House is characterized by its traditional architectural design, reflecting the style of old houses in Al-Ahsa. The house consists of an inner courtyard and multiple rooms, and was built using traditional materials such as clay and gypsum. short_description: The house of allegiance (House of Al -Mulla) is a prominent historical teacher in Al -Ahsa, which embodies a pivotal event in the history of the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, and is considered a symbol of the unity and establishment of the country

name: Pottery Factory (Grash Dyg)
description: {'The site and the date': ['The Pottery Factory (Doughat Al-Gharash) is located in the Al-Rifa\'ah neighborhood of Hofuf city in Al-Ahsa. The history of pottery making in Al-Ahsa dates back thousands of years, and the "Doughah" (the local name for the kiln used to fire pottery) has been an integral part of this ancient craft. "Doughat Al-Gharash" specifically represents the continuity of pottery-making traditions passed down through generations, where artisans have preserved the use of manual methods and the traditional clay kiln.'], 'Architecture and design': ['The pottery factory is characterized by its traditional and practical design, focused on meeting the demands of handmade pottery production. The factory includes clay workshops, areas for shaping vessels, and storage rooms for raw materials and finished products. Its most prominent features are the massive clay kilns (dawag), built from local clay and materials, which are used for firing pottery. These kilns and their surrounding elements reflect the simplicity and strength of traditional architecture designed for a specific industrial purpose.'], 'Historical and cultural importance': ["The Pottery Factory (Doughat Al-Gharash) holds significant historical, cultural, and economic importance. Historically, it's a living testament to the continuity of pottery making, a craft that has flourished in Al-Ahsa for centuries. Culturally, it represents an authentic part of the region's artisanal heritage and symbolizes the manual skills passed down through generations. It also contributes to preserving local identity and provides traditional pottery products of both artistic and practical value."], 'Activities to be done': ['Watch the pottery industry: Follow the craftsmen as they form the clay and turn it into artistic and practical pots', 'Learn about tools and techniques: Understand the traditional tools used in this ancient craft', 'Buying pottery products: The acquisition of hand -made pottery and pottery antiques as souvenirs or for use', 'Photography: taking pictures of the factory, ovens, and craftsmen while working']}
short_description: The pottery factory (jarash) is not just a place to produce pottery. Rather, it is a living museum that displays an ancient art and craft, and it offers visitors a unique opportunity to dive into the depth of authentic al -Ahsa heritage and watching manual creativity embodied in artistic forms.
